scrollToBeginning(int).Description: Scrolls to the beginning of a scrollable layout element. The beginning can be at the top-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the left-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Returns: true if item is found; else, false
scrollTextIntoView(java.lang.String).Description: Performs a forward scroll action on the scrollable layout element until the text you provided is visible, or until swipe attempts have been exhausted. See @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#setMaxSearchSwipes_E@

Parameters: double: is a value between 0 and 1
setSwipeDeadZonePercentage(double).Description: Sets the percentage of a widget's size that's considered as no-touch zone when swiping. The no-touch zone is set as percentage of a widget's total width or height, denoting a margin around the swipable area of the widget. Swipes must always start and end inside this margin. This is important when the widget being swiped may not respond to the swipe if started at a point too near to the edge. The default is 10% from either edge.

Returns: true if item is found; else, false
Parameters: String: content-description to find within the contents of this scrollable layout element.
scrollDescriptionIntoView(java.lang.Stri.Description: Performs a forward scroll action on the scrollable layout element until the content-description is found, or until swipe attempts have been exhausted. See @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#setMaxSearchSwipes_E@

setAsHorizontalList().Description: Set the direction of swipes to be horizontal when performing scroll actions.

Returns: true if scrolled, false if can't scroll anymore
Parameters: int: number of steps. Use this to control the speed of the scroll action.
scrollBackward(int).Description: Performs a backward scroll. If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from top to bottom. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from left to right. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Returns: true if scrolled, and false if can't scroll anymore
flingBackward().Description: Performs a backwards fling action with the default number of fling steps (5). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipe will be performed from top to bottom. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from left to right. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

flingToBeginning(int).Description: Performs a fling gesture to reach the beginning of a scrollable layout element. The beginning can be at the top-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the left-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Parameters: int: use steps to control the speed, so that it may be a scroll, or fling
scrollToBeginning(int, int).Description: Scrolls to the beginning of a scrollable layout element. The beginning can be at the top-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the left-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

scrollToEnd(int).Description: Scrolls to the end of a scrollable layout element. The end can be at the bottom-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the right-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

flingToEnd(int).Description: Performs a fling gesture to reach the end of a scrollable layout element. The end can be at the bottom-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the right-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

setAsVerticalList().Description: Set the direction of swipes to be vertical when performing scroll actions.

Returns: true if scrolled, false if can't scroll anymore
flingForward().Description: Performs a forward fling with the default number of fling steps (5). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from bottom to top. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from right to left. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Returns: true if scrolled, false if can't scroll anymore
scrollForward().Description: Performs a forward scroll with the default number of scroll steps (55). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from bottom to top. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from right to left. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

getSwipeDeadZonePercentage().Description: Returns the percentage of a widget's size that's considered as a no-touch zone when swiping. The no-touch zone is set as a percentage of a widget's total width or height, denoting a margin around the swipable area of the widget. Swipes must start and end inside this margin. This is important when the widget being swiped may not respond to the swipe if started at a point too near to the edge. The default is 10% from either edge.

Returns: max the number of search swipes to perform until giving up
getMaxSearchSwipes().Description: Gets the maximum number of scrolls allowed when performing a scroll action in search of a child element. See @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#getChildByDescription_E@ and @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#getChildByText_E@.

Parameters: int: the number of search swipes to perform until giving up
setMaxSearchSwipes(int).Description: Sets the maximum number of scrolls allowed when performing a scroll action in search of a child element. See @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#getChildByDescription_E@ and @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiScrollable#getChildByText_E@.

Returns: true if scrolled, false if can't scroll anymore
Parameters: int: number of steps. Use this to control the speed of the scroll action
scrollForward(int).Description: Performs a forward scroll. If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from bottom to top. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from right to left. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Parameters: int: use steps to control the speed, so that it may be a scroll, or fling
scrollToEnd(int, int).Description: Scrolls to the end of a scrollable layout element. The end can be at the bottom-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the right-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

Returns: true if scrolled, and false if can't scroll anymore
scrollBackward().Description: Performs a backward scroll with the default number of scroll steps (55). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from top to bottom. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from left to right. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.

ClassDesc: UiScrollable is a @B_android#support#test#uiautomator#UiCollection_E@ and provides support for searching for items in scrollable layout elements. This class can be used with horizontally or vertically scrollable controls.
